gallop.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together
gallop.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: A neighbourâ€™s horse came galloping down the road, riderless.
gallop.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if you gallop, you ride very fast on a horse or you make it go very fast
gallop.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I watched as Jan galloped away.
gallop.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Ian came galloping down the stairs.
gallop.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the movement of a horse at its fastest speed, when all four feet leave the ground together
gallop.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The horses broke into a gallop  (=begin to go very fast).
Mounted police charged at full gallop.
gallop.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a ride on a horse when it is galloping
gallop.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The project began at full gallop.
